alert.note: Alert for Bandera (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 5:48PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bandera County through 630 PM CDT... At 548 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lost Maples State Natural Area to Pipe Creek. Movement was southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Medina, Bandera, Vanderpool, Tarpley, Lakehills, Pipe Creek, Bandera Falls, Kronkosky State Natural Area, Hill Country State Natural Area, Lost Maples State Natural Area and Lake Medina Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
